Merge pull request #37 from warner/improve-tests

jwcrypto-test.js: improve forged-signature tests (munge payload, not sig)

exports the 'require' function with browserify

the newer browserify doesn't expose require by default,
instead making the entire bundle self-contained. passing
this option in makes it so require is available globally.

increasing timeout in cert-test to 2 minutes

without bigint, jwcrypto is slower. enough so that the
1 minute cert was expiring before the tests completed.

converting postinstall script into js files

bundle.sh can't run on windows, so since we have so much
javascript, whats a little more? and now Windows can
come out to play.

moved bigint to optionalDependencies

since jwcrypto can function in pure JS, making bigint optional
lets jwcrypto install on Windows machines, and still works
make check-assertion more pleasing to humans and more useful in tracking down problems. issue #29

Merge pull request #9 from fmarier/utils_inputexception

Copy InputException from jws.js

Copy InputException from jws.js

This is used in the utils.base64urldecode() function but not
defined there.

Because of this, the vep.unbundleCertsAndAssertion() function (used
in the BrowserID verifier) returns this exception message:

  ReferenceError: InputException is not defined

instead of:

  Malformed input: Illegal base64url string!

Merge pull request #108 from mozilla/support-multiple-root-pubkeys

feat(cert): Support checking multiple root pubkeys when verifying a bundle. r=vladikoff,fmarier

feat(cert): Support checking multiple root pubkeys when verifying a bundle.

This change provides the ability to verify a bundle against multiple
candidate public keys, succeeding if any one of them verifies the
signature.  It will allow IdPs to publish multiple active keys during
e.g. a key rotation event.
feat(keys): Add ability to load keys from JWK-compatible format.

Merge pull request #103 from mozilla/rfk/remove-new-cert-format

Revert to old-style data formats as the only support format

Revert to stable data formats as deployed on persona.org.

This removes a bunch of work on "new format" certificates and
assertions, which was designed to bring things into closer compliance
with the JWT spec but was ultimately never deployed.  It reduces
complexity and maintenance burden by remove formats that will not be
seen in the wild.

Merge pull request #85 from seanmonstar/base64url_decode

Base64url decode

this makes all Error classes have stacks

we use custom errors (cool!), but they don't extend from Error (boo!),
nor have stack traces. This adds them.

fix jsBigInteger

new formats include the numbers being base64 encoded, likely to save
bytes. They were being created with .toBase64URL(), which also
url-encodes them. Seems sensible.

On deserializing, the numbers are run through fromBase64(). If native
bigint exists, then fromBase64 is replaced to use Buffer(n, 'base64'),
which correctly url decodes it as well. If it doesn't exist, like on
windows or in the browser, then window.atob is used. It doesn't know
about urlencoded values.

This patch urldecodes the string before passing it to window.atob.
allow client to specify arbitrary keys for a certificate
revert changes to sub - they prevent backwards compatibility with sub-properties under principal
s/public-key/pubkey/
update certify program to conform to new data formats
update generate-keypair script to specify full keytype (DSA and not DS)

Require the new cert format when signing

Ignore the principal attribute in certificates when signing
certificates since we should require new format certs.

This breaks existing BrowserID shims that haven't upgraded to the
new certificate format yet.

Upgrade 'principal.email' to 'sub' during verification

The old format certs should continue to load properly but their
'principal.email' value now needs to be called 'sub'.

Force new certificates to use the new alg names

Stricter rules for certificates formats:

- old format certs required to use an alias
- new format certs forbidden from using an alias

This breaks the old API for generating certificates and requires
users to update the certificate algorithm in their code.
extract 'sub' from certificates
remove support for node 0.6
represent times in all formats in seconds
always generate base64*url* unpadded for key serialization
always generate new format keys
partial
remove accidental addition
package.json version bump to indicate the sweeping changes occuring on this branch
parsing of new format DSA keys
initial support for new key formats, unpadded base64url encoded, triggered by presence of .kty
back out previous format work, to be re-introduced.
leverage the environment for commands in package.json

Merge pull request #85 from seanmonstar/base64url_decode

Base64url decode

this makes all Error classes have stacks

we use custom errors (cool!), but they don't extend from Error (boo!),
nor have stack traces. This adds them.

fix jsBigInteger

new formats include the numbers being base64 encoded, likely to save
bytes. They were being created with .toBase64URL(), which also
url-encodes them. Seems sensible.

On deserializing, the numbers are run through fromBase64(). If native
bigint exists, then fromBase64 is replaced to use Buffer(n, 'base64'),
which correctly url decodes it as well. If it doesn't exist, like on
windows or in the browser, then window.atob is used. It doesn't know
about urlencoded values.

This patch urldecodes the string before passing it to window.atob.
